lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Angels will start the season without their ace, John Lackey, who is out three to four weeks because of a strained right triceps. Lackey, a right-hander, has started rehabilitation and will not participate in any baseball activities until he is re-evaluated, the team said. He won 19 games last season and led the American League with a 3.01 earned run average.
